newsitem.title: USA: Cabletron, Ipsilon in technology pact.
newsitem.headline: Cabletron, Ipsilon in technology pact.

text.p: Cabletron Systems Inc said Monday it has signed a technology collaboration agreement with Ipsilon Networks.
Under the agreement, Cabletron said it will make a $20 million equity investment in Ipsilon, a Sunnyvale, Calif.-based company that provides switching equipment that links data centers.

Darren Orzechowski, Cabletron spokesman said both companies will work to make Cabletron's products, which provide local area networks switching from desktop to data centers, "interoperate" with Ipsilon's switching architecture.
For its part, Ipsilon will work to incorporate Cabletron's SecureFast, a switching software for local area networks, top the IP switching system, he said.

Craig Benson, Cabletron's chairman said that by linking the two companies' complementary technologies, "we can provide customers with a higheer performance, more cost-effective enterprise switching solution."
"We welcome the opportunity to work with Cablertron to bring new high-performance switching solutions to the marketplace," said Brian NeSmith, Ipsilon's president and chief executive officer.
